text: Pint pour at Brine - Mosaic. Poured a crystal clear yellow color, light carbonation, not a lot of head, but still a bit vigorous. Aroma was nice hoppy, with some light lager notes. Earthy hops, light lager notes. Pretty tasty.
Draft at Three Notchd. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, herbs. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, herbs. Medium body with a dry finish.
Draft: Dandelion nose. Clear golden, thin head. Grain, hay, grass, dandelion. Light body, soft carbonation. Refreshing and delightfully hopped.
Tap @ brewery. Watery yellow with thin white head. Light honey and cereal aroma. pleasant pils.
Draft at the source. Clear yellow color. Aroma of black pepper and hay. Taste is peppery and clean.
Clear pale gold, nice head. Aroma was crackery malts over big hops, floral, grassy, and spicy. Flavor was a match, a really well done, clean, and very hoppy pils. Really liked it, well done.
Aromas of grassy hops, floral, freshly mashed grain. Clear gold, somewhat lasting white head. Dry, hoppy, good balance. Light bodied, clean, refreshing and very drinkable.

Keg @ Three Notchd. Gold pour with a small head. Nose is toasted white bread. Peaches. Lemom Cream. Nice and summery flavor. Light and buoyant citrus. Creamy malt. Clean finish. Soft hoppy bite. Light body, active carb. A great pils.
Deep yellow/gold pour with creamy white head and lace. Sweet spicy malt on the nose. Sweet malt and a good resiny bitter finish. Medium bodied with good carbonation. nice beer

On draught at the brewery, it pours the perfect wan golden that is expected of such a beer in the Czech Republic, with a slight haze, and a voluminous pure white head, oh I was transported back to the beer halls of Prague, Plzeň, and Brno. The aroma was laden with lemon blossom, freshly mown grass, and that cracker graininess that pilsner malt delivers. Given that Sterling has a healthy stock of Saaz its heritage it was very much in the ballpark I was expecting. But what about the important bit, the drinking itself, it was lovely. Dry without being thin, zingy without being overly bitter, and packed, I say packed, with hop flavour. If there is one criticism, it is that at 5.6% it is a touch boozy, but it is incredibly moreish so you can happily banish that particular thought.

Draft at Know Good Beer Festival, Charlottesville, 5/3/14. Pours a hazy orange color with a medium sized frothy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of pale bready, doughy malts, snappy grassy and citrus hops. The taste is doughy malt, spicy, herbal hops.. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness, refreshing, well balanced. Very nice beer.
